Name: Ending
Effect: Creatures killed with this weapon are instantly decapitated.

Name: Splinter
Effect: Any weapon dice added to a combat roll are considered automatic wins when attacking a plant based creature (Leshens, Nature Dragons) or wooden structures.

Name: Extendable Weapon
Effect: This weapon can shrink to the size of a small weapon, extend up to reach weapon, as well as any size between. The force of the weapon extending can be used in a variety of way.

Name: Fire Repair and Enhancement
Effect: Weapons repairs in intense fires. If fully repaired and is exposed to increasily intense flames, it will become a higher tier item. Each time it is upgraded, a more intense fire is required upgrade it.

Name: Apparel Storage
Effect: This small mirror can save an outfit the user is wearing. If no outfit is stored inside the user will appear naked in the reflection while holding it. Pressing the mirror while looking into it will swap your apparel between your reflection and what you are currently wearing. This happens in a flash of light, similar to the glare off a mirror. This allows the users to store an outfit inside of the necklace.

Name: Magic Resource Leech
Effect: Sneak attack regain 1 Magic Resource of the user's choice.

Name: Life Leech
Effect: Sneak attacks trigger an Minor Heal to self.

Name: Minorly Enhanced Magic Resource
Effect: +2 to magic Resource capacity.

Name: Enhanced Magic Resource
Effect: +4 to magic Resource capacity.

Name: Greatly Enhanced Magic Resource
Effect: +6 to magic Resource capacity.

Name: Indefinite Gradual Heal
Effect: Minor injuries heal in a short rest. Medium injuries heal durning a long rest. Serious injuries heal over a 24 hour rest. Cannot effect higher tier injuries.

Name: Ariel Assassin
Effect: While performing an aerial attack, gain a +1 to your victory level.

Name: Minorly Enhanced Vitality
Effect: Reduce up to 1d6 of total injury penalty dice.

Name: Enhanced Vitality
Effect: Reduce up to 2d6 of total injury penalty dice.

Name: Greatly Enhanced Vitality
Effect: Reduce up to 3d6 of total injury penalty dice.

Name: Enhaned Criticals
Effect: +1 to victory level to melee sneak attacks and melee attacks on incapacitated opponents.

Name: Dragon Sense
Effect: The bearer of this armor gets an uneasy feeling when there are draconic creatures near.

Name: Minor Draconic Element Resistance
Effect: Minor Resistance vs dragon elemental attacks (Dragonfire, Dragontide, Soulfire, ect)

Name: Retractable Shield
Effect: The user can deploy or retract the medium shield at will.

Name: Light Bound
Effect: This weapon is physical light, and can be absorbed and summoned by a those with the Radiance magic skill.

Name: Metal Feeding
Effect: To repair, item can feed on metal. Different amounts result in different levels of repair and time needed to complete these repairs.

Name: Command Asclepius
Effect: By holding and speaking the command word "Asclepius" the user may instruct this Runecraft to perform various simple actions. "Asclepius, turn into a whip, or short spear." or Asclepius, attack those soldiers."

Name: Swordbreaker Blade Catch
Effect: Any weapon that could reasonably be caught in the swordbreaker can be caught with a Lvl 1 victory, entering into Close Quarters combat. The opponent's weapon is usable while bound. Your main hand weapon (Small, Medium, or Large) can be used in this Close Quarters combat scenario.

Name: Indestructible
Effect: This item can't lose durability.

Name: Moonlight Greatsword
Effect: Just by thought, this ancient sword wreathed in moonlight, becoming a greatsword wreathed in moonlight. While active, it's weapon class becomes a greatsword and now additionally deals radiant damage.

Name: Blessing of the Moon
Effect:
+2 INT while the weapon is bound.

While bound to this weapon, gain the following disabling: "I hear the sword whispering its secrets to me, and I must know them"

Name: Destiny Strength/Reflex
Effect: Strength and reflex are set to level 4.

Name: Destiny Chosen
Effect: Destiny Point Cap set to 6. Gain an additional Destiny Point whenever one is gained. Destiny begins to shape around the user's true desires.

Name: Binding of the Moon
Effect: This weapon can only be picked up by those who sing (out loud or in their head) the Lullaby of the Moon. If the weapon is held for a fortnight, the weapon is bound to the users, severing the bond with the previous bearer. The bearer can now dismiss and summon the blade at will.

Name: Phenomena Detection
Effect: Beats and lights up when turned towards supernatural phenomena in an area. Beats faster the closer it is.

Name: Forbidden Whispers
Effect: When one squeezes the Heart, it whispers secrets directly into their mind concerning the current area, as it senses information about the world beyond mortal recognition. When the Heart is pointed at a person, it reveals secrets about them. Roll a destiny roll (a d20) to determine the level of information obtained.

Name: Light Storage
Effect: Holds 1 Magic Resource worth of light. Can be recharged in Sunlight. Light slowly dissipates from this gem.

Name: Dragon Threat Sense
Effect: The bearer of this armor gets an uneasy feeling when there are draconic creatures near.

Name: Dragon Breath Resistance
Effect: Minor Resistance vs dragon elemental attacks (Dragonfire, Dragontide, Soulfire, ect).

Name: Retractable Shield
Effect: The user can deploy or retract the medium shield at will.

Name: Gradual Heal
Effect: Minor injuries heal in a short rest. Medium injuries heal durning a long rest. A stabilized Serious injuries heal over a 24 hour rest. Cannot effect higher tier injuries.

Name: Minor Heal
Effect: Removes a minor or lesser injury. For a higher tier injury, reduce the dice penalty of the injury by 1. Injury remains at its current tier. Further minor heals have no effect. The higher tier injury requires the appropriate heal tier to completely remove it.

Name: Medium Heal
Effect: Removes a medium or lesser injury. For a higher tier injury, reduce the dice penalty of the injury by 2. Injury remains at its current tier. Further medium healing  has no effect. The higher tier injury requires the appropriate heal tier to completely remove it.

Name: Serious Heal
Effect: Removes a serious or lesser injury. For a higher tier injury, reduce the dice penalty of the injury by 3. Injury remains at its current tier. Further serious healing has no effect. The higher tier injury requires the appropriate heal tier to completely remove it.

Name: Fatal Heal
Effect: Removes a Fatal or lesser injury. Can be used to reattach limbs as long as the limb is not completely destroyed.

Name: Revival Heal
Effect: Return a dead character to life with a serious injury. Can only be performed within minutes of death. For living characters, it completely heals all injuries, regrowing body parts, returning the body to peak performance.

Name: Magic Resource Leech
Effect: Sneak attack regain 1 Magic Resource of the user's choice.Sneak attacks trigger an Minor Heal to self.

Name: Life Leech
Effect: Sneak attacks trigger an Minor Heal to self.

Name: Continous Gradual Heal
Effect: Minor injuries heal in a short rest. Medium injuries heal durning a long rest. A stabilized Serious injuries heal over a 24 hour rest. Cannot effect higher tier injuries.

Name: Enhanced Critical
Effect: +1 automatic win to sneak attacks and incapacitated opponents.

Name: Enhanced Healing
Effect: Any healing acts as the tier above.

Name: Defense Spells
Effect:
The staff is endowed with 10 charges, serving as the fuel for the enclosed spells. When holding the staff, you can use your action to cast one of the following spells from it, provided you have a vocation that can unlock the magic required for these spells: Physical Protection (1 charge) or Mage Shield (2 charges). No components are necessary.

At the break of dawn, the staff regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges. Should the staff exhaust its charges entirely, roll a d20. If the result is 1, the staff shatters and meets its destruction.

Name: Single-use Invisibility
Effect: Applies the Invisibility Spell to the user of this item after being used. Item is destroyed in the process.

Name: Draupnir
Effect: This ring can transform between a weapon and ring. The ring is endowed with 10 charges. With the ring equipped, the user can force a duplication resulting in either a ring or weapon, both which appear in the users hand. Duplicates can not transform, only the original. At the break of dawn, the ring regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges.

Name: Cold Enchantment
Effect: Weapon additionally deals Cold damage.

Name: The Anatoli Curse
Effect: The weapon is cursed on an individual, always return to the user no matter how the weapon is disposed. When this item is used in combat, the bearer becomes blood lusted with each subsequent kill, becoming increasingly bestially minded, possibly even attack friends.
